message.content:
{"id": "13196", 
"title": "Unexpected behavioral difference in Browsing perspective when manipulating source in type hierarchy and method list", 
"description": "There is an unexpected behavioral difference in the Browsing perspective when manipulating the source in the type hierarchy and method list. When performing the following steps:",
"OB": "1. Open the Java Browsing Perspective.
2. Select a type.
3. Select a method in the method list view.
4. Delete the method using the context menu of the method list view.
5. The editor becomes dirty (which is expected).
6. Select another type.
7. Open the type hierarchy on this type and dock the hierarchy view.
8. Select a method in the method list view.
9. Select the same method in the hierarchy view.
10. Delete the method using the context menu of the hierarchy view.
11. The method is deleted on the file system, and the type list view, method list view, and editor are all cleared.",
"EB": "The expected behavior is that when deleting a method in the hierarchy view, it should behave the same way as when deleting a method in the method list view. That is, the method should be deleted from the file system, and the type list view, method list view, and editor should all be cleared.",
"SR": "The issue occurs when deleting a method from the hierarchy view, and it does not match the behavior of deleting a method from the method list view. The expected behavior is for the method to be deleted from the file system, and for the type list view, method list view, and editor to be cleared as well."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '13196', 'title': 'Bug 13196[Browsing] Consequences of changes', 'description': 'Bug 13196[Browsing] Consequences of changes ', 'OB': '', 'EB': '', 'SR': "From the user's perspective, there is an unexpected behavioral difference whenmanipulation source in the type hierarchy and in the method list of the browserperspective.1) open Java Browsing Perspective2) select a type3) select a method in the method list view4) delete the method (context menu of the method list view) editor becomes dirty (ok)5) select another type6) open type hierarchy on this type, dock the hierachy view7) select a method in the method list view8) select the same method in the hierarchy view9) delete the method (context menu of the hierarchy view) method is deleted on file system, type list view, method list view, editorare all clearedNote: This is not the case when the editor is dirty. "}
